00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantAvgDiff.h
00024  * @author Pete Klosterman
00025  * @date   Mon Jun 26 11:27:19 2006
00026  *
00027  * @brief Class for doing MAS 4 average difference signal estimation.
00028  */
00029 #ifndef _QUANTAVGDIFF_H_
00030 #define _QUANTAVGDIFF_H_
00031 
00032 //
00033 #include "chipstream/QuantExprMethod.h"
00034 //
00035 #include <cassert>
00036 //
00037 
00038 /// Standardized name.
00039 #define QUANT_AVGDIFF_STR "avgdiff"
00040 
00041 /**
00042  * @brief Class for doing MAS 4 average difference signal estimation.
00043  * This is the average difference between the pm and mm intensity.
00044  */
00045 class QuantAvgDiff : public QuantExprMethod
00046 {
00047 
00048 public:
00049 
00050   /** 
00051    * What version of the algorithm are we implementing?
00052    * @return version string.
00053    */
00054   std::string getVersion() {
00055     return "2.0";
00056   }
00057 
00058   /**
00059    * @brief Constructor.
00060    * @param param Map of key/value pairs to set user-defined parameters.
00061    */
00062   QuantAvgDiff (std::map<std::string,std::string> &param);
00063 
00064   /**
00065    * Set the number of probes and number of chips to be used for estimation.
00066    * @param numProbes Probe count.
00067    * @param numChips Microarray count.
00068    */
00069   void setBounds (unsigned int numProbes, unsigned int numChips);
00070 
00071   /**
00072    * @brief Set up for estimation given the data about the probe
00073    * set, chip layout and intensities.
00074    *
00075    * @param psGroup Probes to be used.
00076    * @param layout Chip layout annotation.
00077    * @param iMart Raw intensities.
00078    * @param iTrans Transformations to be applied to data before use.
00079    * @param pmAdjust Method to estimate background or MM probe.
00080    * @return True if setup sucessful, false otherwise.
00081    */
00082   bool setUp (ProbeSetGroup& psGroup, const IntensityMart& iMart,
00083     std::vector<ChipStream *>& iTrans, PmAdjuster& pmAdjust);
00084 
00085   /**
00086    * @brief Return number of features (probes).
00087    * @return Feature count.
00088    */
00089   inline unsigned int getNumFeatures() { return m_ProbeCount; }
00090 
00091   /**
00092    * @brief Return number of targets (experiments or chips).
00093    * @return Target count.
00094    */
00095   inline unsigned int getNumTargets() { return m_ChipCount; }
00096 
00097   /**
00098    * @brief Does this quantification method estimate feature effects?
00099    * @return false This method doesn't have feature effects.
00100    */
00101   inline bool haveFeatureEffects() { return false;}
00102 
00103   /**
00104    * @brief Does this quantification method supply residuals?
00105    * @return false This method doesn't have a residual (probe-level result).
00106    */
00107   inline bool haveResiduals() { return false;}
00108 
00109   /**
00110    * @brief Get the residual.  None is supplied by this method;
00111    * errAbort() is called.
00112    * @return Residuals.
00113    */
00114   inline double getResidual (unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx)
00115   {
00116     Err::errAbort ("No residual is available in the avgdiff method.");
00117     return -1.0;
00118   }
00119 
00120   /**
00121    * @brief Get the feature effect of a particular probe. None is
00122    * supplied by this method; errAbort() is called.
00123    * @param probeIx Index of probe in probe sets.
00124    * @return Feature (probe) effects.
00125    */
00126   inline double getFeatureEffect (unsigned int probeIx)
00127   {
00128     Err::errAbort ("No feature effect is available in the avgdiff method.");
00129     return -1.0;
00130   }
00131 
00132   /**
00133    * @brief Get the signal estimate for a particular chip.
00134    *
00135    * @param chipIx Index of chip in experiment.
00136    * @return Signal estimate.
00137    */
00138   inline double getSignalEstimate (unsigned int chipIx)
00139   {
00140     assert (chipIx < m_ChipCount);
00141     return m_SetSignal[chipIx];
00142   }
00143 
00144   /**
00145    * @brief Alias for getSignalEstimate().
00146    * @param chipIx Index of chip in experiment.
00147    * @return Signal estimate.
00148    */
00149   inline double getTargetEffect (unsigned int chipIx)
00150   {
00151     return getSignalEstimate (chipIx);
00152   }
00153 
00154   /**
00155    * Reset data.
00156    */
00157   void clear()
00158   {
00159     m_Probes.clear();
00160   }
00161 
00162   /**
00163    * @brief Set the PM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00164    *
00165    * @param probeIx Index of probe in probe set.
00166    * @param chipIx Index of chip.
00167    * @param data Data to be set.
00168    */
00169   inline void setPMDataAt (unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx, double data)
00170   {
00171     assert (chipIx < m_ChipCount && probeIx < m_ProbeCount);
00172     m_PM[chipIx][probeIx] = (float)data;
00173   }
00174 
00175 /** 
00176    * @brief Get the PM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00177    * 
00178    * @param probeIx - Index of probe in probe set.
00179    * @param chipIx - Index of chip.
00180    */
00181   inline double getPMDataAt(unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx) {
00182     assert(chipIx < m_ChipCount && probeIx < m_ProbeCount);
00183         return (double) m_PM[chipIx][probeIx];
00184   }
00185 
00186   /**
00187    * @brief Set the MM data at probe set probe index and chip index.
00188    *
00189    * @param probeIx Index of probe in probe set.
00190    * @param chipIx Index of chip.
00191    * @param data Data to be set.
00192    */
00193   inline void setMMDataAt (unsigned int probeIx, unsigned int chipIx, double data)
00194   {
00195     assert (chipIx < m_ChipCount && probeIx < m_ProbeCount);
00196     m_MM[chipIx][probeIx] = (float)data;
00197   }
00198 
00199   /**
00200    * @brief Calculate the measurements for the requested collection of
00201    * probe sets.
00202    */
00203   void computeEstimate();
00204 
00205   /** 
00206    * Fill in the information for Self documentation.
00207    * @param doc - Self documenter to be filled in.
00208    */
00209   static void setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc) {
00210     doc.setDocName (QUANT_AVGDIFF_STR);
00211     doc.setDocDescription ("Calculates the average measurement for a probeset using the MAS 4 average difference algorithm, namely the average difference between the pm and mm probe signal.");
00212     // No parameters.
00213   }
00214 
00215   /**
00216    * @brief Supply a brief description of this algorithm.
00217    * @return SelfDoc object.
00218    */
00219   static SelfDoc explainSelf()
00220   {
00221     SelfDoc doc;
00222     setupSelfDoc(doc);
00223     return doc;
00224   }
00225 
00226   /**
00227    * @brief Create a new AvgDiff object.
00228    *
00229    * @param param Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00230    * @return Pointer to SelfCreate object.
00231    */
00232   static SelfCreate *newObject (std::map<std::string,std::string> &param);
00233 
00234   /**
00235    * Custom configuration for this QuantMethod
00236    */
00237   virtual void setParameters(PsBoard &board) 
00238   {
00239     // no-op here to override the error from parent class
00240   }
00241 
00242 private:
00243 
00244   /// Number of chips in experiment.
00245   unsigned int m_ChipCount;
00246   /// Number of probes (features) in probe sets.
00247   unsigned int m_ProbeCount;
00248   /// Data matrix for PM probes.
00249   std::vector<std::vector<float> > m_PM;
00250   /// Data matrix for MM probes.
00251   std::vector<std::vector<float> > m_MM;
00252   /// Signal for probeset in different chips.
00253   std::vector<double> m_SetSignal;
00254 
00255 };
